newsitem.title: GERMANY: Telefonica sees digital TV project delayed.
newsitem.headline: Telefonica sees digital TV project delayed.

text.p: Spanish telecommunications group Telefonica said on Friday the market entry of the digital television platform it is backing would be delayed from its orginally-scheduled March start date.

"It will now come some time later, before the summer," a Telefonica official said in Frankfurt, the first stage of an international roadshow to promote the state's sale of its remaining stake in the business.
The official made the comment in the presence of Telefonica chairman Juan Villalonga, who had on Thursday told Spanish radio the service could be up and running in March.
The official said there had been delays relating to the other partners in the project and their involvement with the platform, without giving further details.

Telefonica said this week its digital TV project had been legally formed under the name of Digital Television Distributor (DTD), with other partners drawn from the broadcasting and wider media sector.

Earlier on Friday, Spain's government cabinet said it had approved new legislation that will mean that any television decoder brought onto the market will have to be compatible with those from other suppliers.
Spain's first digital platform was launched on Thursday by Canal Satellite. The decoders ordered for the service will not meet the new requirements specified by the regulation.
